required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Decision Making in Hypothetical Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Patient and Consumer Decision Making in a Hypothetical Case of Carpal Tunnel Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: Participants will be presented with a hypothetical scenario of carpal tunnel and asked to make a decision for that case.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be randomized into 1 of 2 groups and receive a hypothetical scenario of carpal tunnel, with or without cost information, and asked to decide if that hypothetical patient should undergo a carpal tunnel release.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized into 1 of 2 study arms arm 1: control arm 2: intervention. We will use a random block generator to assign participants to their study arm.
study_design_info.masking_description: The care provider and patient will not be informed as to which group the participant is in

primary_outcome.description: Participants are asked to answer "Should you get surgery right now," with the options of definitely yes, probably, maybe, maybe not, probably not, and definitely not

secondary_outcome.description: a 7 item, likert response questionnaire used to elicit participant opinions on cost in health care. This is a non-validated tool.

arm_group.description: Participants in the control group will be given a hypothetical scenario about carpal tunnel syndrome and asked to make a treatment decision for that hypothetical patient.

Participants in the intervetion group will be given a hypothetical scenario about carpal tunnel syndrome as well as information about the cost of treatment and asked to make a treatment decision for that hypothetical patient.

intervention.description: participants will be given information on the personal and societal costs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients presenting to hand clinic OR mturk workers
- age 18 or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- traumatic mechanism of injury
